snippet: Amid talk of a recovering economy, housing woes continue to plague parts of New York City, falling particularly hard on blacks.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column laments housing woes that continue to plague areas of black homeownership in New York City, foreclosure belt that stretches across Brooklyn and Queens.
lead_paragraph: Amid talk of a recovering economy, housing woes continue to plague parts of New York City, falling particularly hard on blacks.

headline.seo: In a Queens Neighborhood, Signs of Uneven Burdens From a Housing Crisis
headline.main: That Comeback Trail for the Economy? Here, It’s Littered With Foreclosures
headline.print_headline: That Comeback Trail for the Economy? Here, It’s Littered With Foreclosures
